reviewText:
Early Access Review

I might be able to recommend this game if it wasn't horribly pay to win.

Evidence:
-With real money, you can buy equipment that is twice as good as what you can buy with in-game currency.

-With real money, you can equip shells that make you do 50% more damage.

-With real money, you can *rent* premium vehicles. They are phenomenally strong.

There is no obvious or easy way to earn the real currency. Until this is changed, it doesn't matter how fun the game may be, I can't recommend it. I will change this review to reflect gameplay if these extremely unfair mechanics are changed.
voteText: 287 of 317 people (91%) found this review helpful 11 people found this review funny

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nit's p2w.  I'd love to see vehicle combat games make a comeback but this isn't the way to do it.  Consumables bought with gold, the premium currency, are literally twice as effective as anything a free player can get.  There is even premium ammo you can buy that gives you 50% more damage.
voteText: 179 of 209 people (86%) found this review helpful 5 people found this review funny

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIn many ways a quicker and somewhat more action oriented World of Tanks.  Combat is decent, and the variety between the 4 classes of vehicles is okay.  Steering/driving is reasonably responsive while still having a good feeling of weight.  Weapons don't have quite the same feeling of impact or weight, unfortunately, and are fairly simple, but they work. Unfortunately with premium purchasable vehicles with higher stats and gold premium ammo that does higher damage, I simply cannot recommend the game.  The game itself is decent, and free, and worth taking a look at if you have a decent internet connection for the download, but the potential pay2win monetization means I cannot, will not, invest the time to explore deeper or recommend it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When i first clicked on it i thought it was some different version of MWO (Mech Warrior Online)[www.mwomercs.com]. No it isn't, its some P2W russian World of Tanks parody. The models are loosely based on Russian Armoured Personnel Carriers, Infantry Fighting Vehicles, Rocket Artillery etc.

In general the game is terrible, UI sucks, crazy P2W,unbalanced matches, but apart of that what poked my eyes most were the name suggestions. When you type in a taken name it shows a set of suggestions and they're ♥♥♥♥ing hilarious, I'll toss in a few examples: when i typed ♥♥♥♥♥ they suggested me Holy_Hard_♥♥♥♥♥, when typed Gay they come up with Gay_Hunter, instead of Obama they recommended me Knicks_Murder_Obama, when i typed in Sex, they recommended me to choose Loud_Great_Sex, well sure why not? What was strangest of what I found is that suggested names sometimes get outright political undertone and often the kind which is not very popular in Russia, for example typing in Assad, they suggested me Maniac_Assad_Murder". Could this be the beginning of the rise of AI?

I've took a few snippets of these ridiculous naming suggestions for curious people:
http://i.imgur.com/FXax8bo.png
http://i.imgur.com/1XbhPOA.png
http://i.imgur.com/OTOMxJf.png
http://i.imgur.com/bMNTdkJ.png
http://i.imgur.com/ru6tKIy.png"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

1. There is no fight balance. And it makes profit for developers - if you meet powerful enemies, you can always take gold items to win. It always works, so you get used to buy it, developers have you money, you have your victories - profit for everybody. So they not interested in working on balance.
2. Players online is very low. People left this game, and situation become worse every day. In this pitiful situation players from clan GUARDS may be very noticeable. They always have everything gold that can be bought in the game. So you can ask - where they take it. Its simple. They are paid for their work for game. Helpers (green writing in chat) can earn for 20 000 to 60 000 gold coins, moderators (orange letters in chat) up to 100 000. And also all of them earn gold-shots for riding Couriers account - 10 000 gold shots per one battle. Do you donate enough to win the battle against them? Because without gold you cant win. May be you would meet them very rear if there is more people playing MWO.

Sometimes, ex-moderators try to sell their salary gold to players and get real money instead. They dont know where to spent it, so why not)))
3. Early access is endless in MWO. And its also very profitable. Today we buy paints, vip accounts, gold items to level up one car, tomorrow developers can change characteristics of you car and it will become uncomfortable and weak in battle and you have to level up another car, that become stronger - so you will pay. But no one will return you money or your time - its early access, isnt it?) I felt like they stole from me. What changes are waiting players and wil it be for good or worse - no one can tell.
5. We were promised that after Retribution it will be possible to play on any car because they will be balanced against each other. Its a lie. Take for example intelligence vehicles (its really bad synonym they choose, even I with my poor English can understand it) - you can comfortably play and win only on 2 or 3 cars, others you dont even need to level up and they gather dust in the garage. Because their specification were modified to be weak. And this concern to engineers and other. Cars havent been balanced, you should use only very small number of them to win.
5. The only thing that really well-considered is system of punishments and rules , I have strong feeling that on punishments all the creative resources were spend. However, you can break almost all of them, because top of the administration does not play their game (why do they need this ♥♥♥♥ ), admins are detached from the players , and those moderators who play cover most of disorders , if they ban honestly, a month later there will be no one to play with.
So you can break rules until you own comrades kindly inform admins about it. Moreover, one can fool the system and earn many thousands of gold coins using referral accounts and then start working as moderator, ye they have one of that sort.
I was banned first time for giving my account to my friend (yes rules are very strict about lending account to friends, so read them carefully), but you can always have it back if you give information about your friends who also break rules and then they will be banned, you will have you account back - fair and square. My second ban was for this published opinion about MWO. It all reminds me Stalin, dont know why)))
6. Developers dont play their own game any more. Some years early they played and it was another game and online was much higher. And at least they knew what should be fixed and what should be postponed.

7. Today I think that the game in this statement and with all problems including gold flows from Guards, does not worth to donate in. Being short-sighted I donate a lot and now can advise not to repeat my mistakes.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The base game is free and is fun to goof around with for a while.  There are some issues that would need to be addressed before I would continue to play it, or recommend it to a friend:

- Matches felt unbalanced
- There is very little help available for the UI in game
- No control over which location or what type of matches to play in
- The cash store contains many items that would give players an unfair advantage in exchange for real money

My personal opinion is that I would wait until this game matures a little and see if it becomes more balanced.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros:
*I am not sure if there is one to be honest, maybe somewhere deeper in the game.

Cons:
* Bad english translations with sentences barely making sense and sometimes not at all.
* Inconsistant load times for the game menu and matches.
* Bad match making
* Russian company - only two things worse, slavic conmen and nigerian princes, all of which want to take your money.
* UI is a World of Tanks clone
* Pay to win gaming model, see for yourself take a browse thru thier store, plenty of real money items that will give you an edge in playing.
* Slow ♥♥♥ cars, feels like your underwater.
* No strategy to the fighting, just drive and shoot, bout the only strat is to have everyone fire on same cars.
* Game uses auto aim , making it for wussies.
* Can see where all opponants are, once again lack of any kind of strategic or tactical play.
* Unbelievably horrible sound effects.

The game starts like a WoT clone but that is where it stops. The game model is clearly pay to win and the gameplay itself is sub-par maybe a 4 out of 10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

7/10 - would play again but not spend money on

Decent game, very much like world of tanks but much better, the focus is more on the different vehicle types and less on making sure you are super skillful at landing every shot.

There are a lot of russian speakers in the game so teamwork is a little difficult but I have not had anyone intentionally griefing me.

Do not go in thinking of winning every game unless you are willing to sink a ton of money into it as the vehicles you can pay for are only rented and the enhancements are single use so you have to keep paying.

I have a lot of fun just playing around, not taking it seriously.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game to pass some free time.
Not the most demanding graphics, so it should be playable even on older PC's.
There's tons of things to work for, so you don't get bored too fast either.
I would say it's good game for it's price.

Don't expect to start winning in your first few battles, but once you level up a few levels you'll get into the race.

I should also mention that you should be in a clan or make one with your friends, as many additional features become availabile, and you also level up a bit faster when you are playing with friends/clan members.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Surprisingly elegant vehicle shooter with gameplay that's easy to get into. Several game modes with lots of customization for different weapons, consumables and so on, complete with upgrade progress. As a free game, certainly worth a few hours of simple entertainment.

Beware, however, of an iceberg of pay-to-win design hiding in its complex interface.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I gave the game a decent chance and can say overall it isn't worth it. Even with premium you level at a snails pace. Were talking hours to reach level 3. This is with VIP so without it is way way worse.

Artillary gameplay is awful overall compared to WOT and feels like your barely participating etc.. Engineering amounts to get rushed down by any vehicle in the game and hope your teammates kill them. The tech tree is non existant. Basically it's click improve on some parts and swap guns if yours has any. Also improvements go to 40+ for basically any component in the entire game.

Now for the next big issue is matchmaking. So, a newer game released with MM that sticks completely wrong tiers vs each other. Also matches take ages so you get to feel entire stomps for long periods. We had a match where I was a T1 engineer with 3+ T1 scouts and T1 tanks vs things up to tier 3 and no T1's on the entire enemy team.

Basically skip this. Also it's minorly p2w and the dev claims hes fixing it.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nPlayed one match in the game. Not only won, but came in first out my team mates. Upon further inspection I realize my success was due to OP paint job.. yea.. a paint job. Apparently paint jobs or more than just for looks.  Looking at the store as well shows the game is super heavy pay to win. Such a beautiful young game, but that just muddied its waters and im not gonna fish in it. The strongest heavy tank you can freely obtain in the game has an armor base of 7500, but if you purchase their premium heavy tank it has 15,000 armor points! That's absurd. As fun as my one match was, I would not touch this again. Pay to win is a bad game market to delve into. It shows the makers only care about money.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A lot of people these days are just looking for a reason to yell pay to win. I think this game has a large integration of its cash shop to the point its almost invasive but I don't feel this game is pay to win so narrowing down all the negative reviews about that you are left with some key points.

-Graphics to me are great, they feel a bit dated but still carry the aestetic perfectly its a very enjoyable environment.

-Controls were a LOT smoother than I initially figured, but the starting cars drive like radio control cars.

-The arenas have a great sense of scale and ambient noise it really brings you into the universe, the car to car audio voices get old fairly fast wish we could customise them or SOMETHING.

-There is a console aim" like in the old xbox console shooters where it gives you some assist aim on automatic weapons
date: you can take that as bad or good.\n\n-A great team dynamic reminds me a lot of chrome hounds in the class of vehicles
recommended: I look forward to trying all the vehicle types.\n\nIts free
hoursPlayed: and its fun I suggest everyone give it a shot. Worst case you can try it and not like it so you have a reason to come back to this review and yell at me. Best case you have a new fun free game. Win-win."
voteText: December 22, 2015

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I enjoy this game very much.

Pros and cons.

Pros
Easy to play (W,A,S,D,Shift,Mouse,Controls)
Multiple modes  (capture the flag, destroy the enemy and others)
Lots of Vehicle upgrades
Lots of Vehicles

Cons
Experience based on your contribution to the fight

That's what I have seen so far.
1. Is the game P2W (Pay to Win)?
A lot of the things in the market you can purchase with silver, which you make with every battle fought. The equivalent of the silver item in the gold (gold is bought with real money) markey is much better, but you can still purchase a like-item with in-game currency.
2. Is the game a copy of World of Tanks (WoT)?
Nowadays people say that to please themselves. Honestly, I hated WoT but I like this one very much. If a War game is a copy of another war game just because there is infantry and weapons, armor and enemy units, guess what, it's a War game...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Not recommended               Score                                                          Recommended
0                                3.5                                                                    10

NOTE: You CAN have alot of fun...
HOWEVER, It is currently hit or miss for me... I cannot recommend it simply because of severe balance issues at times... Otherwise, I think it is fine and could be better with more maps... Hoi9wever, when the blancing is off, it is way off.  Also, need a mechanism to balance a battle where a team member just simply never plays tyhat round...  You had 4 members against 4... but one of them never started on your team... so you are down one... AND their empty vehicle keeps respawning to become a victim... Either a way to replace that person... OR.... at the very least stop them from respawaning...  Something..

Not sure if ther balancing issue is due to not enough players in the queue to make up a battle. Sso they work with what they have???

In my experience withg PVP, you play level one player with level one players... Here, they try and mix it up... that CAN be good with a proper balance ( and hopefully, likewise balance play styles)  Example:

Team one
stormtank  Level 50
engineer    Level 15
Artillary     Level 20
Scout         Level  5

Team Two
stormtank  Level 50
engineer    Level 15
Artillary     Level 20
Scout         Level  5


However, this is not what I see mostly.. Worst example: I was brought into a battle the other day against a 5 member Clan with mostly level 50's agains a mismatch of players with much lower Levels....

Might as well have been unarmed civilians against the Mechanized Warbots
--------------
Playable teams/Battles??? YES... on occasion...

Recommend more DEV work on balancing or gaining more players to balance with...    AND.... some more maps.

With that work... BALANCING at min
date:
I would bump it up to 7.5....  more maps and such I could riase it a little more..

Not sure it could ever be a 10.. but it could be a sweet 8.5 casual PVP game.
"

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nMetal War Online: Retribution is a game I have been playing a bit recently. I have to say I like it, it plays like a cheaper World of Tanks but it looks scifi. For the layperson the game works by having you queue up into matchmaking as one of a large variety of vehicles in out of 4 classes, scouts (light vehicles) stromtanks" (tanks)
recommended: and artillery vehicles. after selecting your vehicle and gear (smoke screen
voteText: nitrous
helpfulPercent: etc.) you are dropped into a game. There are a few different game modes
votesHelpful: you have modes where you capture points and turrets
votesFunny: and team deathmatch type modes. Concerning the maps
commentsCount: there are a good deal of them
column16: just under 20 at last count. The higher level you get
column17: the more maps you unlock to play
column18:
at least from what I can tell.


Really I would recommend Metal War Online: Retribution to anyone looking for a fun free to play vehicle based shooter
column19: or to anyone looking for something to substitute there World of Tanks cravings without actually playing World of Tanks.\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As a fan of the older tank based squad game world of tanks, I can say soundly that this game is true to its fan and lore. The developers can take a while to make the changes needed, but overall they do well. Still highly reccomend for those out there that enjoy a slower paced, skill based tank based shooter game.

I am Russ_B0llocks, and I approve of this game. MWO: R is the real deal. Don't get tricked into the liquid MWO, which is a scam made by some canadians who don't even know how to make an animated garage, and charge 80 dollars for its content packs.

MWO: R is one of those games that you can literally just breeze into. A mere handful of minutes is more than enough to attain the skill needed to get 2x double kills and getting away with murder.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Its not too bad, its a little hard to learn at first and its slightly unbalanced, but not too badly. its slightly p2w but its not too bad. its similar to world of tanks and armored warfare but mainly combat based. You have to stick with your team which is nice and you cant just drive out on your own or you could easily get destroyed.

The four car classes each take a useful role, like the scouts for well, scouting, the engineers for healing and freezing enemies in place, the stromtanks or whatever theyre called for taking a lot of damage and soaking it in for the rest of your team nearby... but it has very high damage and health. and the artillery which i dont know what to say about yet, but it can pretty much hit you from anywhere if you're spotted with a huge splash that does quite a bit of damage.

So far i like it, but it could be better.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

after 175 hours in game, there are so many flaws, as in most games #1 server lag spikes are crazy, being disconnected etc.
developers clearly did not go for realism, cars with pew pew guns kill tanks (normally with ease)... need i say more.. #2
#3 the matching system is unbelievable. your team = 1 pro+all noobs (or close to cap player) vs team of pros... now in the interest of fair play this game gets a whopping zero score. changing it to level 1-10, 11-20,21-30, 31-40, 41-50 and i know still slightly unfair but not as bad as it currently is. level 10 tank vs same level 50 tank.. level 50 tank can almost 1 shot you even with the over priced consumables they dont bridge that gap.

and for some good news: game is fun sometimes, it is indeed Free to Play, with that pay to win business model for those with more money than sense, paying for 30 seconds of single use items..
